cards.name: The Fool
cards.description: The Fool represents new beginnings, innocence, spontaneity, and unlimited potential. This card suggests a time of fresh starts and taking leaps of faith.

cards.name: The Magician
cards.description: The Magician represents manifestation, resourcefulness, and inspired action. This card suggests harnessing one's full potential to achieve goals.

cards.name: The High Priestess
cards.description: The High Priestess represents intuition, mystery, and inner knowledge. This card suggests trusting your inner voice and accessing your subconscious mind.

cards.name: The Empress
cards.description: The Empress represents fertility, nurturing, and abundance. This card suggests creative expression and connecting with nature's rhythms.

cards.name: The Emperor
cards.description: The Emperor represents authority, structure, and leadership. This card suggests establishing order and taking control of situations.

cards.name: The Hierophant
cards.description: The Hierophant represents tradition, conformity, and spiritual guidance. This card suggests learning from established institutions and conventional approaches.

cards.name: The Lovers
cards.description: The Lovers represents relationships, choices, and harmony. This card suggests important decisions about love, values, and desires.

cards.name: The Chariot
cards.description: The Chariot represents determination, willpower, and victory. This card suggests overcoming obstacles through confidence and control.

cards.name: Strength
cards.description: Strength represents inner strength, patience, and gentle control. This card suggests mastering raw emotions through compassion and soft power.

cards.name: The Hermit
cards.description: The Hermit represents introspection, inner guidance, and solitude. This card suggests seeking wisdom through contemplation and self-reflection.

cards.name: Wheel of Fortune
cards.description: The Wheel of Fortune represents cycles, fate, and turning points. This card suggests embracing life's ups and downs and recognizing pivotal moments.

cards.name: Justice
cards.description: Justice represents fairness, truth, and cause and effect. This card suggests a time of karmic balance and important decisions.

cards.name: The Hanged Man
cards.description: The Hanged Man represents surrender, letting go, and new perspectives. This card suggests viewing things from a different angle and accepting what is.

cards.name: Death
cards.description: Death represents transformation, endings, and rebirth. This card suggests major life changes and letting go of what no longer serves.

cards.name: Temperance
cards.description: Temperance represents balance, moderation, and patience. This card suggests finding middle ground and combining different elements harmoniously.

cards.name: The Devil
cards.description: The Devil represents bondage, materialism, and shadow self. This card suggests examining unhealthy attachments and facing one's inner demons.

cards.name: The Tower
cards.description: The Tower represents sudden change, upheaval, and revelation. This card suggests destructive transformation that leads to enlightenment.

cards.name: The Star
cards.description: The Star represents hope, inspiration, and serenity. This card suggests a period of spiritual insight, renewed optimism, and connection to the divine.

cards.name: The Moon
cards.description: The Moon represents illusion, intuition, and the subconscious. This card suggests a time of uncertainty and facing hidden truths.

cards.name: The Sun
cards.description: The Sun represents joy, success, and positivity. This card suggests a time of clarity, warmth, and achievement.

cards.name: Judgement
cards.description: Judgement represents awakening, rebirth, and inner calling. This card suggests a time of reflection, reckoning, and answering a higher calling.

cards.name: The World
cards.description: The World represents completion, integration, and accomplishment. This card suggests a time of fulfillment, success, and unity.

cards.name: Ace of Wands
cards.description: The Ace of Wands represents new beginnings, inspiration, and creative potential. This card suggests the spark of a new idea or venture.

cards.name: Two of Wands
cards.description: The Two of Wands represents planning, making decisions, and contemplating expansion. This card suggests viewing your situation from a higher perspective.

cards.name: Three of Wands
cards.description: The Three of Wands represents expansion, foresight, and overseas opportunities. This card suggests preparation meeting opportunity.

cards.name: Four of Wands
cards.description: The Four of Wands represents celebration, harmony, and homecoming. This card suggests a time of joy and completion of a phase.

cards.name: Five of Wands
cards.description: The Five of Wands represents competition, conflict, and rivalry. This card suggests a time of challenges and competing interests.

cards.name: Six of Wands
cards.description: The Six of Wands represents victory, success, and public recognition. This card suggests achievement and reward for efforts.

cards.name: Seven of Wands
cards.description: The Seven of Wands represents defense, perseverance, and maintaining one's position. This card suggests standing your ground against opposition.

cards.name: Eight of Wands
cards.description: The Eight of Wands represents swift action, movement, and air travel. This card suggests rapid progress and news arriving quickly.

cards.name: Nine of Wands
cards.description: The Nine of Wands represents resilience, perseverance, and last stands. This card suggests courage and persistence in the face of adversity.

cards.name: Ten of Wands
cards.description: The Ten of Wands represents burdens, responsibility, and hard work. This card suggests carrying heavy loads and feeling overwhelmed.

cards.name: Page of Wands
cards.description: The Page of Wands represents exploration, excitement, and discovery. This card suggests new ideas and enthusiastic beginnings.

cards.name: Knight of Wands
cards.description: The Knight of Wands represents action, adventure, and impulsiveness. This card suggests charging forward with passion and energy.

cards.name: Queen of Wands
cards.description: The Queen of Wands represents confidence, determination, and social butterfly. This card suggests vibrancy and natural leadership.

cards.name: King of Wands
cards.description: The King of Wands represents leadership, vision, and entrepreneurship. This card suggests bold action and creative authority.

cards.name: Ace of Cups
cards.description: The Ace of Cups represents new beginnings in matters of the heart, intuition, and emotional fulfillment. This card signifies an opportunity for love, compassion, and spiritual connection.

cards.name: Two of Cups
cards.description: The Two of Cups represents a harmonious partnership, emotional connection, and mutual understanding. This card suggests a coming together of two people or energies.

cards.name: Three of Cups
cards.description: The Three of Cups represents celebration, joy, and community. This card suggests a coming together of friends or like-minded individuals to share in abundance and emotional fulfillment.

cards.name: Four of Cups
cards.description: The Four of Cups represents introspection, contemplation, and temporary disillusionment. This card suggests a need to step back and reflect on one's emotional landscape.

cards.name: Five of Cups
cards.description: The Five of Cups represents loss, grief, and disappointment. This card suggests a focus on what has been lost rather than what remains.

cards.name: Six of Cups
cards.description: The Six of Cups represents nostalgia, innocence, and fond memories from the past. This card suggests a return to simpler times or a need to reconnect with one's inner child.

cards.name: Seven of Cups
cards.description: The Seven of Cups represents illusion, fantasy, and choices. This card suggests a need to ground oneself and avoid becoming lost in daydreams or unrealistic options.

cards.name: Eight of Cups
cards.description: The Eight of Cups represents abandonment, emotional detachment, and the need for a personal journey. This card suggests leaving behind something or someone that is no longer fulfilling.

cards.name: Nine of Cups
cards.description: The Nine of Cups represents emotional fulfillment, satisfaction, and self-confidence. This card suggests a sense of accomplishment and the ability to enjoy the fruits of one's labor.

cards.name: Ten of Cups
cards.description: The Ten of Cups represents emotional wholeness, harmony, and fulfillment. This card suggests a state of domestic bliss, emotional security, and a sense of belonging.

cards.name: Page of Cups
cards.description: The Page of Cups represents sensitivity, creativity, and openness to new emotional experiences. This card suggests an inner child-like wonder and a capacity for empathy.

cards.name: Knight of Cups
cards.description: The Knight of Cups represents romance, imagination, and emotional sensitivity. This card suggests a poetic, artistic, and compassionate nature.

cards.name: Queen of Cups
cards.description: The Queen of Cups represents emotional intelligence, intuition, and empathy. This card suggests a nurturing, compassionate, and deeply intuitive nature.

cards.name: King of Cups
cards.description: The King of Cups represents emotional maturity, empathy, and sensitivity. This card suggests a balanced, compassionate, and emotionally intelligent leader.

cards.name: Ace of Pentacles
cards.description: The Ace of Pentacles represents new financial or material opportunities, manifestation, and abundance. This card suggests the seed of material success and prosperity.

cards.name: Two of Pentacles
cards.description: The Two of Pentacles represents balance, adaptability, and juggling multiple responsibilities. This card suggests the need to maintain flexibility while managing resources.

cards.name: Three of Pentacles
cards.description: The Three of Pentacles represents teamwork, craftsmanship, and skill development. This card suggests collaboration and recognition for quality work.

cards.name: Four of Pentacles
cards.description: The Four of Pentacles represents security, conservation, and material stability. This card suggests a need to balance between saving and spending.

cards.name: Five of Pentacles
cards.description: The Five of Pentacles represents hardship, financial loss, and material challenges. This card suggests a period of difficulty but also the availability of help if sought.

cards.name: Six of Pentacles
cards.description: The Six of Pentacles represents generosity, charity, and the flow of material resources. This card suggests both giving and receiving with grace.

cards.name: Seven of Pentacles
cards.description: The Seven of Pentacles represents assessment, patience, and long-term success. This card suggests evaluating progress and planning for future growth.

cards.name: Eight of Pentacles
cards.description: The Eight of Pentacles represents craftsmanship, dedication, and skill development. This card suggests focused effort and commitment to mastery.

cards.name: Nine of Pentacles
cards.description: The Nine of Pentacles represents self-reliance, luxury, and material abundance. This card suggests independence and enjoying the fruits of one's labor.

cards.name: Ten of Pentacles
cards.description: The Ten of Pentacles represents wealth, family legacy, and long-term success. This card suggests material security and generational abundance.

cards.name: Page of Pentacles
cards.description: The Page of Pentacles represents study, ambition, and new opportunities in material matters. This card suggests a practical and studious approach to goals.

cards.name: Knight of Pentacles
cards.description: The Knight of Pentacles represents reliability, hard work, and routine. This card suggests methodical progress and dedication to goals.

cards.name: Queen of Pentacles
cards.description: The Queen of Pentacles represents nurturing, abundance, and practical wisdom. This card suggests material success through careful management.

cards.name: King of Pentacles
cards.description: The King of Pentacles represents wealth, business, and material success. This card suggests mastery in financial and material matters.

cards.name: Ace of Swords
cards.description: The Ace of Swords represents breakthrough, clarity, and mental power. This card suggests new ideas, mental clarity, and the power of truth.

cards.name: Two of Swords
cards.description: The Two of Swords represents difficult decisions, stalemate, and mental balance. This card suggests a need to face choices with clarity and wisdom.

cards.name: Three of Swords
cards.description: The Three of Swords represents heartbreak, emotional pain, and sorrow. This card suggests difficult but necessary truths and the process of healing.

cards.name: Four of Swords
cards.description: The Four of Swords represents rest, recuperation, and meditation. This card suggests taking time for mental renewal and peaceful contemplation.

cards.name: Five of Swords
cards.description: The Five of Swords represents conflict, defeat, and hollow victory. This card suggests winning at a cost and the aftermath of confrontation.

cards.name: Six of Swords
cards.description: The Six of Swords represents transition, moving forward, and leaving behind. This card suggests a journey toward calmer waters and mental peace.

cards.name: Seven of Swords
cards.description: The Seven of Swords represents deception, strategy, and stealth. This card suggests careful planning and potential betrayal or dishonesty.

cards.name: Eight of Swords
cards.description: The Eight of Swords represents restriction, imprisonment, and self-imposed limitations. This card suggests feeling trapped but having the power to break free.

cards.name: Nine of Swords
cards.description: The Nine of Swords represents anxiety, nightmares, and mental anguish. This card suggests overwhelming worry and the need to face inner fears.

cards.name: Ten of Swords
cards.description: The Ten of Swords represents painful endings, rock bottom, and transformation. This card suggests the end of a difficult situation and the potential for renewal.

cards.name: Page of Swords
cards.description: The Page of Swords represents curiosity, mental energy, and new ideas. This card suggests intellectual pursuit and the thirst for knowledge.

cards.name: Knight of Swords
cards.description: The Knight of Swords represents swift action, ambition, and determination. This card suggests charging forward with intensity and purpose.

cards.name: Queen of Swords
cards.description: The Queen of Swords represents clear thinking, intellectual power, and independence. This card suggests wisdom through experience and sharp discernment.

cards.name: King of Swords
cards.description: The King of Swords represents intellectual power, authority, and truth. This card suggests mental clarity and ethical leadership.
